WaistLVLyingCrunch.name: Lever Lying Crunch
WaistLVLyingCrunch.preparation: Lie on machine with legs over pads or feet on foot bar. Grasp bars near head at each side.
WaistLVLyingCrunch.execution: With hips stationary, raise upper back pad by flexing waist. Return and repeat.
WaistLVLyingCrunch.comments: Lever fulcrum should be aligned with waist, not hips. Some lever lying crunch machines have handles to sides. See Spot Reduction Myth.

WaistLVPushCrunch.name: Lever Push Crunch
WaistLVPushCrunch.preparation: Sit on machine with back of hips against hip support. Push hips securely back by pushing feet against foot bar. Grasp handles and push resistance lever until arms are extended in front of body.
WaistLVPushCrunch.execution: Push resistance lever forward by flexing waist. Return by allowing upper body to be pushed back until low back is hyperextended. Repeat.
WaistLVPushCrunch.comments: Foot bar should be adjusted to allow for slight bend in knees as hips are forcefully being pushed against hip pad. Throughout exercise, keep arms straight and hips securely pushed back against hip pad. See Spot Reduction Myth.
WaistLVPushCrunch.stabilizers: pectoralisminor, gluteusmaximus, tricepsbrachii, quadriceps, pectoralissternal, deltoidanterior

WaistLVSeatedCrunch.name: Lever Seated Crunch
WaistLVSeatedCrunch.preparation: Sit on machine with back and hips against back supports. If available, place lower legs under pads or on platform. Grasp handles above and position back of arm against pads to each side.
WaistLVSeatedCrunch.execution: With hips stationary, flex waist so elbows travel downward. Return and repeat.

WaistLVSeatedCrunchArmBar.name: Lever Seated Crunch (arm bar)
WaistLVSeatedCrunchArmBar.preparation: Sit on machine with back and hips against padded supports. Place feet on floor or feet bars so thigh is approximately horizontal. Grasp handles and position forearms on bars or pads.
WaistLVSeatedCrunchArmBar.execution: With hips stationary, flex waist so arms and upper torso travel forward and downward. Return and repeat.
WaistLVSeatedCrunchArmBar.comments: Taller individuals will place feet on floor, whereas shorter individuals will place feet on feet bars. See Spot Reduction Myth.

WaistLVSeatedCrunchArmPad.name: Lever Seated Crunch (arm pad)
WaistLVSeatedCrunchArmPad.preparation: Position seat so shoulders are same height of padded lever. Sit on machine and place arms over lever pad. Push padded lever down slightly until shoulder is fixed at approximately 90 or slightly greater.
WaistLVSeatedCrunchArmPad.execution: With hips stationary, flex waist in C shape so elbows point downward. Return and repeat.
WaistLVSeatedCrunchArmPad.comments: Maintain shoulders fixed at 90 or greater so upper arm and upper back are close to perpendicular. Men should keep chest close to padded lever. Women may choose to position chest as close as possible without making contact with inside of lever. See Spot Reduction Myth.

WaistLVSeatedCrunchChestPad.name: Lever Seated Crunch (chest pad)
WaistLVSeatedCrunchChestPad.preparation: Position seat so chest is same height of padded lever. Sit on machine with back of hips against hip pad. Place hands on outside of lever pad.
WaistLVSeatedCrunchChestPad.execution: With hips stationary, flex waist in C shape so shoulders travel forward and downward. Return and repeat.
WaistLVSeatedCrunchChestPad.comments: On some models, feet can be positioned behind pad under seat. See Spot Reduction Myth.

WaistLVSeatedLegRaiseCrunch.name: Lever Seated Leg Raise Crunch
WaistLVSeatedLegRaiseCrunch.preparation: Sit on machine with back against back support and lower legs under padded bar. Grasp handles above to each side.
WaistLVSeatedLegRaiseCrunch.execution: Pull handles down while pulling lower leg bar up by flexing waist and pelvis. Return and repeat.
WaistLVSeatedLegRaiseCrunch.stabilizers: latissimusdorsi, tricepsbrachii, tensorfasciaelatae, pectoralissternal, sartorius, deltoidposterior, teresmajor, pectineus, quadriceps

WaistLVSideLyingLegHipRaise.name: Lever Side Lying Leg Hip Raise
WaistLVSideLyingLegHipRaise.preparation: Lie on side with head on elevated head pad and legs between padded rollers. Flex hips slightly until rear and front of thighs are snugly positioned against pads. Flex knees so back of lower leg is against furthest padded roller. Grasp handles in front of head.
WaistLVSideLyingLegHipRaise.execution: Pull knees toward arms by flexing waist and hips. Return and repeat.
WaistLVSideLyingLegHipRaise.stabilizers: latissimusdorsi, deltoidposterior, hamstrings, teresmajor, tricepsbrachii, pectoralissternal
